lines.text: This is the story of George Harvey Bone who resided at number 12, Hangover Square, London, S.W. in the early part of the Twentieth Century. The British Catalogue of Music lists him as a Distinguished Composer~~~
All my life I've had black little moods.
But, Dr. Middleton, music is the most important thing in the world to me.
No, Mr. Bone, the most important thing is your life.
"All for you. There's not a thing I wouldn't or that I couldn't do." You wrote that for me, George. But you've never really tried to find out, have you?

[chanting]
Please do remember the fifth of November. Gunpowder, treason and plot. I see no reason why gunpowder treason should ever be forgot.
Why didn't he try to get out?
And what did Guy Fawkes do?
He tried to blow up the Houses of Parliament.
I can make a few steps go an awful long way.
